text.p: The following are the main stories from Wednesday morning's Albanian newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- A woman died and another woman was wounded when two people exchanged fire in a main street in Tirana on Tuesday.
- The European Commission said in a letter to two opposition parties that it would closely watch the upcoming local elections in Albania.
- In a letter to OSCE chairman Flavio Cotti, four opposition parties denounce a request of President Sali Berisha not to welcome OSCE observers to the local elections.
- Vegetable prices have doubled since last week.
- Heavy rain over the last days has caused many traffic problems in northern Albania.
- A 20-year old man has been detained in the western city of Durres for attempting to sexually abuse an 11-year old girl.
- Omonia, the ethnic Greek minority association in southern Albania, will elect its new leaders this month.
- Polio outbreak in Albania claims sixth victim.
- Prime Minister Aleksander Meksi said the government had taken all the necessary measures to ensure free and fair local elections.
- The Democratic Party to start its electoral campaign on September 22 for the October 20 local poll.
- Tirana has officially invited OSCE observers for the local elections, parliament's presidency said, denying opposition reports it did not want them to monitor Albania.
- Agim Fagu, famous former basketball player, was chosen by the Socialist Party to run for mayor in the local elections in the capital Tirana.
- Jailed Socialist leader Fatos Nano tells his party to be more actively engaged ahead of the October 20 elections.
